metadata.name: Lure Colors Dataset
metadata.description: A dataset containing various colors of fishing lures.

history_highlights.event: First production lure, the Wiggler, made as company begins.
Patent received for scale pattern produced by spraying paint through netting.
Intro boxes are replaced with classic two-piece cardboard Creek Chub boxes.
Military stencils began on the lures and continued through 1950.
Improved lip and through-wire construction introduced.
Last year for fly rod lures.
Mass production of plastic lures begins.
Transition from glass eyes to tack eyes.
"Gold Foil" labels began and continued through 1978.
The last new lure, the Cheekie, is introduced.
Company sold to Lazy Ike Corporation.

lures.name: Wiggler
lures.eyes: Glass eyes, some have a red backing to the eyes, some color variations have no eyes. Tack eyes are known on special orders after 1960
lures.notes: The original and most iconic Creek Chub lure. Designed by Henery Dills in 1916.

lures.name: Baby Wiggler
lures.eyes: Glass eyes, some have a red backing to the eyes, some color variations have no eyes.
lures.notes: Smaller version of the original Wiggler. Austin 'Toad' Van Houton created a special variation of Silver Shiner with a unique lip.

gold_embossed_pressed_label.label: Injured Minnow or Creek Chub Injured Minnow
Injured Minnow, Creek Chub Injured Minnow
